subject: Sexual Health
title: Menstrual Hygiene Globally
description: A 60-second lesson on Menstrual Hygiene Globally.

hook.text: Millions of girls miss school every month because they lack access to menstrual products and clean facilities.

buildup.text: In sub-Saharan Africa, up to 20% of girls miss school during their period due to lack of supplies.

discovery.text: Period stigma compounds the problem. In many cultures, menstruation is considered shameful or dirty.

twist.text: Countries like India and Kenya have started eliminating tax on menstrual products and distributing them free in schools.

climax.text: Menstrual hygiene access is increasingly recognized as a human rights and educational equity issue.

punchline.text: A period should never mean missing school.

quiz.question: Why do millions of girls miss school monthly?
options: Lack of menstrual products and clean facilities
